page.title: 21Education in the Village
page.content:
1.DR. CHALLONER'S HIGH SCHOOL,one of the few remaining grammar schools in the country, split from Dr Challoner's Grammar School in September 1963.

Originally built for 3-form entry of girls at 11, it now has 6-form entry at 11. Places are obtained through the 11+ examination, consisting of 3 verbal reasoning tests.



2.LITTLE CHALFONT LIBRARY, built in 1975, was closed by the council in 2007. It is now a Community library run by volunteers, open 5 days a week it is funded by the local community, and has its own website.
Contribution by: Mr Richard Speakman
